main event: One oblong bright red object was observed drifting north at 12,000 feet in Bert, Michigan on 3 September 1956.
interesting points: The object was initially sighted at a 90-degree azimuth.,It was visible for six minutes before fading out of sight.,The object's color was described as bright red.,The sighting is suspected to be caused by an aircraft based on its characteristics.,The observation was made by a civilian.
